intro: Otandra cernua, commonly known as the weeping otandra, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its drooping clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Otandra cernua thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas.
